title: U.S. 'gravely alarmed' by reports of chlorine gas use by Syrian government
text:
February 6, 2018 / 1:06 AM / in 28 minutes U.S. 'gravely alarmed' by reports of chlorine gas use by Syrian government Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The United States is “gravely alarmed” by reports the Syrian government has used chlorine gas in Idlib Province, the U.S. State Department said in a statement on Monday. 
It also said the Russian government, by shielding the Syrian government from accountability, has “not lived up to its commitments.” Reporting by Eric Beech; Editing by Mohammad Zargham
